list.label: Language Name:
list.item: Macedonian
list.label: Code:
list.item: mk
list.label: Reference:

list.item: Collective plural has been removed for the sake of compatibility with other Slavic languages. It is considered as derivation, thus collective plurals are separate entries in the dictionary.

Language specific are distal and proximal definiteness, e.g. човек - човеков, човекон, луѓево, луѓено; жена - женава, женана, жениве, женине; дете - детево, детено, децава, децана. They are formed with the suffixes: ов, ва, во (proximal), он, на, но (distal) for singular, and во, ве, ва (proximal), но, на, на (distal) for plural.
Oblique unifies dative and accusative form of some masculine nouns, e.g. човек - човека; Иван - Ивана.
Two vocative forms exist with same MSD, e.g. народе / народу (народ) are both Ncmsvn.

div.head: MSD Index
div.p: This index gives the list of morphosyntactic descriptions (MSDs) and their features. In the table below, the first column gives the MSD, the second its expansion into a feature-structure, the third gives the number of entries in the lexicon (1,323,718 entries), and the fourth gives some examples as word-form/lemma. The list was extracted form the Macedonian MULTEXT-East lexicon.

list.item: Macedonian verbs do not have the infinitive, therefore, their lemma is the present form of third person in singular.
Auxiliary verbs are сум/е and има. They are used as separate verbs, or as part of compound tenses.
Modal verbs are: сака, мора, може and треба. They usually preceed the conjunction да and a verb: сака да игра, мора да учи, може да прави, треба да внимава.
All the other verbs are main, e.g. гледа, оди, тргне, пее. Their inflections are regular, and they depend on the last vowel of the lemma.
Auxiliary verbs and particles би and ќе are used to create compund tenses.

Biaspectual verbs, such as адресира and благодари can differ in second and third person in singular only (адресира - адресираше), or for all persons and number: благодарив - благодарев, благодари - благодареше, благодари - благодареше, благодаривме - благодаревме, благодаривте - благодаревте, благодарија - благодареа.
Resultative participle ending in л is called an l-form. It is part of the compound past tenses, including past perfect, as well as the conditional.

Identical forms for the second and third person in singular for imperfect (игра - играше; пее - пееше; оди - одеше) and aorist (адресира - адресира, стигне - стигна; благодари - благодари), as well as for all persons in the compound past (игра - играл, играла, играло, играле; пее - пеел, пеела, пеело, пееле; оди - одел, одела, одело, оделе) are marked with a dash, to avoid excessive ambiguity in the lexicon.
Gender occurs in those compound tenses which have the l-form: играл, учел, правел, пеел.

In the table below, the first column gives the MSD, the second its expansion into a feature-structure, the third gives the number of entries in the lexicon (1,323,718 entries), and the fourth gives some examples as word-form/lemma. list.item: Qualificative adjectives are those which have degrees: добар – подобар – најдобар, добра – подобра – најдобра, добро – подобро – најдобро.

Possesive adjectives embrace those which show a possession or ownership: Питагоров, Лаппасов, Марикина, as well as all the possesive personal pronouns: мој, твој, негов, нејзин, наш, ваш, нивен and their forms, due to their inflectional suffixes, which are identical with the adjectives.
Ordinal adjectives unite the ordinal numbers: прв, втор, петти, 10-ти, due to their inflectional suffixes, which are identical with the adjectives.
Verbal adjectives are the passive past participles of the verbs: виден, слушнат, чуен.
All the adjectives which do not belong to previous four groups, e.g.: таков, поинаков, англиски, воен, готов are general.

Language specific are distal and proximal definiteness of adjectives, e.g добриов, добрава, доброво, добриве / добрион, добрана, доброно, добрине. They are formed with the suffixes: ов, ва, во (proximal), он, на, но (distal) for singular, and ве (proximal) and не (distal) for plural.
Elative adjectives, made with the prefix пре are separate lemmas: преран – преран, instead of ран – преран.

In the table below, the first column gives the MSD, the second its expansion into a feature-structure, the third gives the number of entries in the lexicon (1,323,718 entries), and the fourth gives some examples as word-form/lemma. Pronoun Type=reflexive Gender=neuter Number=singular Clitic=no Definiteness=yes

list.item: Verbal adverbs are verb derivatives ending in јќи: сакајќи, одејќи, пеејќи.
Some adverbs, such as: многуте, малкуте, неколмина can have definiteness in their inflectional paradigm.
Elative adjectives, made with the prefix пре are separate lemmas: прерано – прерано, instead of рано – прерано.

div.head: MSD Index
div.p: This index gives the list of morphosyntactic descriptions (MSDs) and their features. In the table below, the first column gives the MSD, the second its expansion into a feature-structure, the third gives the number of entries in the lexicon (1,323,718 entries), and the fourth gives some examples as word-form/lemma. The list was extracted form the Macedonian MULTEXT-East lexicon.

list.item: Macedonian language has prepositions only: во, на, до, спроти, наспроти, etc.

list.item: The ordinal numerals have the same inflectional characteristics as adjectives.
